intro: Hieracium megabombycinum, commonly known as the giant bombycin hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium megabombycinum is often found in meadows and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
